::The Vok::

Out in the nothingness of space, a Vok being watched over earth. It
had been doing this very thing for countless years, but there was
always something to draw his attention. Lately it has been a war on
earth. The Vok had taken interests in time being continuous, and had
recruited a bot from the planet to work for him. That bot was Zardus,
but hadn't accomplished much lately.

The Vok was examining Zardus's progress on the planet when the call
came. It instantly knew who the caller was: an Ikoto. Those annoying
beings were a thorn sometimes, but the Vok delt with them.

Within seconds though time wasn't mesured in units by the Vok, the
golden head floated up to the three Ikoto. It looked them over flatly.

"I have recieved your call and arrived," it said without speaking,
"Why have you disturbed my duty?"





--- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> *Predicts this post to be the next winner for best entrance post 
> sequence.* =P
> 
> --- Azafroth / Brodak / Uokarase / Ikoto ---
> 
> Azafroth floats in the endless void that is known as outer space. 
> His corporal body shimmers as he absorbs the energies being 
> produced by a quasar, a loan bright light that dominates the 
> surrounding nothingness. He notes that his next target source of 
> energy is the event horizon of a distant black hole. His thoughts 
> drift to the nearest Ikoto to him, Brodak, who stirs from his semi-
> eternal feasting. "Azafroth, this bores me," He breakes off from the 
> energy source, having sated himself enough for now. "We will find 
> something---" he pauses to consider something, "something more 
> interesting, perhaps the destruction of a planet," Azafroth's non-
> existent eyes flare up, "Ha, a suitable idea... Uokarase, what is 
> your input on this idea?" The two direct their attentions to 
> another... thing feasting off the quasar. Uokarase breaks off from 
> the source to join the others in thought. "I find the idea amusing, 
> how shall we go about it?" Azafroth's translucent body shimmers 
> multiple colours, "I have an idea. The Vok." he says simply, "We 
> shall dally with them. I know that they have at least one planet 
> under their control, or they attempt to dominate it. We will propose 
> to them a sort of gamble on the outcome of that planet. We 
> propose a bet that a group of out pawns will attempt to over thrown 
> the Vok's pawns and control the planet. If this happens we will 
> cause a chain reaction explosion of the planet and," Azafroth 
> almost flickers with delight as the others listen, "and we will use 
> the energy from the explosion as a charger for our bodies, much 
> better than stupid quasars." He finishes and has left the other
Ikoto 
> flickering as well. Brodak and Uokarase both immediately agree, 
> and they begin periodic teleporations to find the Vok.
> 
> --------------------------------------------------------------------
> 
> At an indeterminable time later, the three Ikoto have traveled far,
to 
> an indeterminable location of energizing beauty. Azafroth projects a 
> summoning though to any nearby Vok for communication. "I have 
> sent out a summoning emphatic and telepathing message to all 
> Vok with in my range (which is large), as you have just witnessed." 
> All three beings away a response with certainty.
